structures.shortDescription: A seahorse-shaped structure crucial for memory formation and spatial navigation.
structures.detailedDescription: The hippocampus is a complex brain structure embedded deep in the temporal lobe. It has a major role in learning and memory, particularly in the formation of new memories about experienced events (episodic memory) and facts (semantic memory). The hippocampus is also crucial for spatial memory and navigation.

functions.name: Memory Consolidation
functions.description: Transfers information from short-term to long-term memory

functions.name: Spatial Navigation
functions.description: Contains place cells that help create cognitive maps

functions.name: Pattern Separation
functions.description: Distinguishes between similar experiences to reduce memory interference

functions.name: Emotion Regulation
functions.description: Works with amygdala to attach emotional significance to memories

connections.description: Main input/output pathway for hippocampal processing
Part of Papez circuit for memory

clinicalRelevance.involvement: One of the first regions affected, leading to memory loss
Common seizure focus, may require surgical intervention

developmentalInfo.developmentTimeline: Forms early but continues developing into adolescence
developmentalInfo.neurogenesis: One of few brain regions with adult neurogenesis

researchNotes.discovery: Discovery of time cells that encode temporal information
researchNotes.significance: Explains how hippocampus encodes episodic memories

researchNotes.discovery: Place cells discovered to have grid-like firing patterns
researchNotes.significance: Nobel Prize winning work on spatial navigation

beginner.summary: The hippocampus is like your brain's 'save button' for memories. It helps you remember facts and experiences.
beginner.analogy: Think of it as a librarian that decides which books (memories) are important enough to keep permanently.
keyPoints: Important for finding your way around

intermediate.summary: The hippocampus is essential for declarative memory formation and spatial navigation, working closely with surrounding cortical areas.
keyPoints: Converts short-term memories to long-term storage
Contains specialized cells for spatial mapping

advanced.summary: The hippocampus exhibits a trisynaptic circuit crucial for memory encoding via LTP/LTD mechanisms, with distinct functional gradients along its longitudinal axis.
keyPoints: CA3 performs pattern completion via recurrent collaterals
DG performs pattern separation via sparse coding
Phase precession and theta rhythms coordinate memory encoding

animations.title: Place Cell Activity

assessmentQuestions.question: What is the main function of the hippocampus?
assessmentQuestions.explanation: The hippocampus is primarily responsible for forming new memories, particularly episodic and spatial memories.

assessmentQuestions.question: Which pathway is the main input to the hippocampus?
assessmentQuestions.explanation: The perforant path from the entorhinal cortex is the main input pathway to the hippocampus.

pathways.name: Papez Circuit
pathways.description: Neural circuit involved in emotion and memory

systems.name: Limbic System
systems.description: Structures involved in emotion, behavior, and memory

glossary.definition: Persistent strengthening of synapses based on recent patterns of activity
